name: Antrim Square
description:
This set dance was composed in 2003 by Des Jackson, a dancer with the Sydney Irish Ceili Dancers in Australia. Mr. Jackson was born in County Antrim, Ireland and chose to create a set dance to celebrate the place of his birth.
Gents dance first on the left foot and ladies dance first on the right foot. The first step is usually forward but see the big square pattern wherein dancers dance backward initially.Swing in waltz hold.

pictureData.name: Landscape at the Giant's Causeway in County Antrim, Northern Ireland
pictureData.author: Dimitry Anikin

movements.name: Lead around and back
movements.description: Lead all the way around in 8b, lead back 8b. Gents right arm over ladies right shoulder, left hands held in front. When turning to lead back, merely turn on the spot without spinning around each other.

movements.name: Ladies star
movements.description: Right hand star (or wheel) clockwise for 4 bars, reverse and left hand star back to place.

movements.name: Gents star
movements.description: Right hand star (or wheel) clockwise for 4 bars, reverse and left hand star back to place.

movements.name: Square and House
movements.description: In waltz hold, advance toward the couple on the right, back into opposite place, house home.

movements.name: Antrim Square
movements.description: Each dancer will dance a small square as part of the overall set. Tops take inside hands and advance to the center, release hands, face their partners and reverse into side position (4b). Tops then turn toward the opposite top, back toward their original side, turn to face their partner and advance to meet their partner at home (4b). At the same time the sides face their partners, reverse away from each other, turn and advance to the opposite person (4b) turn toward the center advance toward their partner, turn toward the center and reverse to home (4b). Everyone reverse the square with side couples leading (8b).
Side couples lead the Antrim square this time.

movements.name: Lead around and back
movements.description: This time use a hop step.

movements.name: Crossover
movements.description: Top ladies cross to opposite ladies position passing right shoulders in 2b, gents cross to opposite gents position passing left shoulders. Repeat. During the repeat, the ladies should not go all the way home and the gents should pass just far enough to get into a little Christmas formation at the center of the set.

movements.name: Slide and change
movements.description: Slide in 2 and in 2-3, back 2 and back 2-3. House to opposite, repeat to home.

movements.name: Swing your corner
movements.description: All turn and swing your corner (left of gent, right of lady).

movements.name: Swing your partner
movements.description: Dance back home (2b) and swing your partner (6b).
